# CV Standards for Professional Employment

## Overview
This document establishes the standards for creating employment-ready CVs that are optimized for Applicant Tracking Systems (ATS) and human readability. These standards are derived from analysis of successful CVs from candidates hired at top-tier tech companies like Google, Meta, and Amazon.

## Core Principles

### 1. Maximum Legibility
**Purpose**: Hiring managers spend 6-10 seconds scanning a CV. Every element must be instantly readable.

**Standards**:
- Pure black text (#000000 or RGB 0,0,0) for maximum contrast
- No colored backgrounds or fancy graphics
- Clean, professional fonts (Helvetica, Arial, Calibri)
- Sufficient white space between sections
- Clear visual hierarchy

### 2. ATS Compatibility
**Purpose**: 75% of CVs are filtered by ATS before reaching human eyes.

**Standards**:
- Simple formatting with no tables, text boxes, or columns
- Standard section headers (Experience, Education, Skills)
- Keywords matching job descriptions
- No images, headers/footers, or complex layouts
- PDF format for final submission

### 3. Quantified Achievements
**Purpose**: Numbers validate impact and separate senior from junior candidates.

**Standards**:
- Every achievement must include metrics when possible
- Use percentages, absolute numbers, time frames
- Bold key metrics for quick scanning
- Focus on business impact, not just technical tasks

## Typography Standards

### Font Specifications

#### Primary Font
- **Font Family**: Helvetica (PDF), system sans-serif (web)
- **Fallbacks**: Arial, Calibri
- **Why**: Clean, professional, excellent readability at all sizes

#### Font Sizes (PDF)
```
Name/Header:     18-20pt (bold)
Job Title:       16pt (normal weight)
Section Headers: 12pt (normal weight, underlined)
Job Positions:   11pt (bold)
Body Text:       10pt (normal)
Contact Info:    9pt (normal)
Dates/Metadata:  9-10pt (normal)
```

#### Font Sizes (Web)
```
Name/Header:     2.5rem (40px) - mobile, 3rem (48px) - desktop
Job Title:       1.25rem (20px) - mobile, 1.5rem (24px) - desktop
Section Headers: 1.5rem (24px) - mobile, 1.75rem (28px) - desktop
Job Positions:   1.125rem (18px)
Body Text:       1rem (16px)
Dates/Metadata:  0.875rem (14px)
```

#### Font Weights
```
Name:            Bold (700)
Job Titles:      Bold (700) - in experience section
Section Headers: Normal (400) - with underline for emphasis
Body Text:       Normal (400)
Key Metrics:     Bold (700) - percentages, numbers, achievements
```

#### Line Height (Leading)
```
Headings:        1.2 (tight for impact)
Body Text:       1.5-1.6 (comfortable reading)
Lists:           1.4-1.5 (balance between compact and readable)
```

#### Letter Spacing
```
Name/Headers:    0 to 0.02em (slightly wider for large text)
Body Text:       0 (default) to 0.01em (subtle improvement)
ALL CAPS:        0.05em (essential for readability)
```

### Spacing Standards

#### Vertical Spacing (PDF)
```
After Name:              6mm
After Job Title:         6mm
After Contact Info:      7mm
Between Sections:        6-7mm
After Section Headers:   4.5mm
Between Job Entries:     5-6mm
Between Bullet Points:   2-2.5mm
Line Height in Bullets:  4-4.5mm
```

#### Vertical Spacing (Web)
```
After Name:              2rem (32px)
After Job Title:         1.5rem (24px)
Between Sections:        3rem (48px)
After Section Headers:   1.5rem (24px)
Between Job Entries:     2rem (32px)
Between Bullet Points:   0.5rem (8px)
Paragraph Spacing:       1rem (16px)
```

#### Horizontal Spacing
```
Page Margins (PDF):      20mm all sides
Content Padding (Web):   1rem mobile, 2rem tablet, 3rem desktop
Indentation:             5mm (PDF), 1.5rem (web) for bullet points
```

## Content Standards

### Professional Summary
**Length**: 3-4 lines maximum
**Format**: Single paragraph, no bullets
**Content**:
- Years of experience + role
- 2-3 key quantified achievements
- Leadership/team management if applicable
- Core technical stack

**Example**:
```
Senior Software Developer and Developer Department Head with 4 years of 
engineering experience, including 2 years leading cross-functional teams. 
Led platform modernizations affecting 100K+ users (Vue 2‚Üí3, Nuxt 2‚Üí3), 
reduced production bugs by 45% through testing infrastructure, and decreased 
runtime errors by 60% via company-wide TypeScript adoption.
```

### Skills Section

#### Organization
1. **Soft Skills** (listed first)
   - Leadership abilities
   - People management
   - Communication skills
   - Problem-solving approaches

2. **Technical Skills** (listed second)
   - Programming languages
   - Frameworks/libraries
   - Tools and platforms
   - Methodologies

#### Formatting
- **Labels**: Bold (e.g., "Soft Skills:", "Technical Skills:")
- **List**: Comma-separated, normal weight
- **NO brackets**: "JavaScript" not "JavaScript (JS)"
- **NO proficiency levels**: Don't add "Expert" or "Proficient" labels
- **NO redundant text**: Clean, scannable lists

**Good Example**:
```
Soft Skills: Team Leadership, Mentoring, Coaching, People Management, 
Constructive Feedback, Rapid Learning

Technical Skills: JavaScript, TypeScript, Vue, Nuxt, Node.js, SQL, HTML, 
CSS, Docker, Make, WebAssembly, Service Workers
```

**Bad Example**:
```
Expert Level: JavaScript (JS), TypeScript (TS)
Proficient: Vue.js Framework, Node.js Runtime
Experienced: Docker (Containerization)
```

### Experience Section

#### Job Entry Format
```
[Job Title - BOLD] [Dates - RIGHT ALIGNED]
[Company Name] ‚Äì Remote
‚Ä¢ Achievement with quantified metric in bold
‚Ä¢ Another achievement with numbers in bold
‚Ä¢ Technical implementation with impact
```

#### Job Title Requirements
- **Position names**: BOLD, 11pt (PDF) / 1.125rem (web)
- **Multiple titles**: Separate with " / " (e.g., "Senior Developer / Team Lead")
- **Location indicator**: Add "Remote" or city name after company
- **Company name**: Normal weight, acts as subtitle

#### Achievement Bullet Points
**Structure**: Action Verb + What You Did + Quantified Impact

**Bold the following**:
- Percentages (e.g., **60% reduction**)
- Absolute numbers (e.g., **5+ engineers**, **100K+ users**)
- Time metrics (e.g., **6 months**, **2 years**)
- Key outcomes (e.g., **zero downtime**, **100% success rate**)

**Examples**:
```
‚úì Led developer team of 5+ engineers for 2 years, overseeing technical 
  strategy, code quality, and project delivery.

‚úì Introduced TypeScript across 5+ critical projects, reducing production 
  runtime errors by 60% and improving code maintainability.

‚úì Established comprehensive testing infrastructure with Vitest and Cypress, 
  achieving 80%+ code coverage and reducing production bugs by 45%.
```

**DO NOT**:
```
‚úó Responsible for leading team and managing projects
‚úó Worked on TypeScript migration (no metrics)
‚úó Improved testing (vague, no quantification)
```

#### Remote Work Indicator
**Format**: " ‚Äì Remote" after company name
**Examples**:
- "Connex Carrier Services Ltd (ConnexCS) ‚Äì Remote"
- "Google Inc. ‚Äì Remote"
- "Startup XYZ ‚Äì San Francisco, CA" (if on-site)

### Projects Section

#### Entry Format
```
[Project Name - Bold with Link]
Description in 1-2 sentences focusing on impact and technologies.
Technologies: Tech1, Tech2, Tech3
```

#### Link Format
- **Web**: Clickable project name
- **PDF**: Project name with underline, full URL visible or clickable
- **Format**: "npm" for NPM packages (not "üì¶ NPM Package")

#### NO Emojis or Special Characters
‚ùå Don't use: ‚≠ê, üì¶, ‚ñ∏, ‚Ä¢, ‚Üí, ‚úì
‚úÖ Use instead: Hyphens (-), pipes (|), simple bullets (‚Ä¢)

### Education Section

#### Format
```
[Institution Name - Full, Official]
[Degree Type], [Field of Study]          [Years]
```

#### Standards
- Full institution names (not abbreviations in main text)
- Degree type first, field second
- Years right-aligned
- Add notes if degrees overlap (e.g., "Completed while working full-time")

**Example**:
```
ZICAS (Zambia Institute of Chartered Accountants)
Bachelor's degree, Internet Technology and Computing          2019 - 2023
Note: Completed while working full-time at ConnexCS (remote)

Wuhan University, China
Bachelor's Degree, Computer Software Engineering              2015 - 2019
```

## Character Encoding Standards

### Prohibited Characters in PDF
These characters often render incorrectly or show as boxes/random symbols:

‚ùå **Emojis**: Any emoji (‚≠ê, üì¶, üöÄ, üíª, etc.)
‚ùå **Special Bullets**: ‚ñ∏, ‚ñ∫, ‚ñ†, ‚óÜ
‚ùå **Arrows**: ‚Üí, ‚áí, ‚Üî, ‚ü∂
‚ùå **Checkmarks**: ‚úì, ‚úî, ‚úÖ, ‚òë
‚ùå **Mathematical**: ‚àà, ‚äÇ, ‚àû, ‚âà
‚ùå **Typographic**: ‚Äî, ‚Äì, ", ", ', ' (use standard -, ", ')

‚úÖ **Safe Characters**:
- Standard hyphen: `-`
- Standard quotes: `"` and `'`
- Pipe separator: `|`
- Standard bullet: `‚Ä¢` (U+2022)
- Parentheses: `()`, Brackets: `[]`
- Forward slash: `/`

### Text Encoding
- **File encoding**: UTF-8 without BOM
- **PDF encoding**: WinAnsi or built-in PDF fonts
- **Test all special characters**: Always preview PDF before submitting

## Color Standards

### Color Palette
```css
/* Primary Colors - Use Sparingly */
--color-primary: #025E73;      /* Dark Teal - for accents only */
--color-accent: #F2668B;       /* Pink - for highlights only */

/* Text Colors - Use for All Content */
--color-text: #000000;         /* Pure Black - body text */
--color-text-light: #464646;   /* Dark Gray - less important text */
--color-heading: #000000;      /* Pure Black - all headings */

/* Background Colors */
--color-background: #FFFFFF;   /* Pure White - page background */
--color-section-bg: #FAFAFA;   /* Very Light Gray - subtle sections (web only) */

/* Interactive Elements (Web Only) */
--color-link: #025E73;         /* Dark Teal - links */
--color-link-hover: #03A688;   /* Bright Teal - hover state */
```

### Color Usage Rules

#### PDF Version
- **Text**: Pure black (#000000) for ALL text
- **Backgrounds**: Pure white (#FFFFFF) only
- **Links**: Black text with simple underline
- **NO colored backgrounds**: Not even for section headers
- **NO colored text**: Black only for maximum ATS compatibility

#### Web Version
- **Text**: Pure black (#000000) for body and headings
- **Links**: Dark Teal (#025E73) with underline
- **Backgrounds**: White or very subtle gray
- **Accents**: Use sparingly for interactive elements only

### ATS-Safe Color Rules
1. Text must have 7:1 contrast ratio minimum (black on white = 21:1 ‚úì)
2. Never use color alone to convey information
3. Links must be identifiable by underline, not just color
4. Section headers must be recognizable by position and size, not color

## Layout Standards

### PDF Layout
```
Page Size:        A4 (210mm x 297mm)
Orientation:      Portrait
Margins:          20mm all sides
Columns:          Single column only (no multi-column)
Max Pages:        2 pages (strict requirement)
Alignment:        Left-aligned (except right-aligned dates)
```

### Web Layout
```
Max Width:        1200px (centered)
Mobile:           100% width with 1rem padding
Tablet:           90% width with 2rem padding
Desktop:          1200px with 3rem padding
Responsive:       Mobile-first approach
```

### Section Order (Standard)
1. Header (Name, Title, Contact)
2. Professional Summary
3. Skills (Soft Skills, then Technical Skills)
4. Professional Experience (reverse chronological)
5. Projects (most impressive first)
6. Education (reverse chronological)
7. Certifications (if applicable)
8. Additional Links (optional)

## Technical Implementation

### PDF Generation Settings
```typescript
{
  orientation: 'portrait',
  unit: 'mm',
  format: 'a4',
  compress: true,
  precision: 2,
  userUnit: 1.0
}
```

### Font Loading (PDF)
- Use built-in fonts: Helvetica, Times, Courier
- Avoid custom font embedding (increases file size and ATS issues)
- Helvetica is the gold standard for CVs

### Link Implementation
- **Web**: `<a>` tags with proper ARIA labels
- **PDF**: `textWithLink()` with visible underlines
- **Both**: Full URLs should be readable if printed

## Quality Checklist

Before submitting your CV, verify:

### Content
- [ ] Professional summary is 3-4 lines maximum
- [ ] Every achievement has a quantified metric
- [ ] Key numbers are bolded in experience section
- [ ] Skills are organized (Soft Skills first, then Technical)
- [ ] No redundant descriptions (e.g., "JavaScript (JS)")
- [ ] Remote indicator added to all remote positions
- [ ] No emojis or special characters
- [ ] Timeline has no overlaps or gaps
- [ ] Education explains any overlapping degrees

### Formatting
- [ ] Pure black text (#000000) throughout
- [ ] No colored backgrounds or graphics
- [ ] Font sizes follow standards (10-11pt body)
- [ ] Line height is 1.5-1.6 for body text
- [ ] Consistent spacing between sections (6-7mm PDF)
- [ ] Job titles are bold
- [ ] Section headers are underlined (not bold)
- [ ] Bullet points have proper spacing (2-2.5mm)

### Technical
- [ ] PDF is exactly 2 pages (no more, no less)
- [ ] All links are clickable in PDF
- [ ] File name is professional (FirstName_LastName_CV.pdf)
- [ ] PDF opens correctly in multiple viewers
- [ ] Web version is responsive (test mobile)
- [ ] No console errors or warnings
- [ ] All tests passing

### ATS Optimization
- [ ] Standard section headers (Experience, Skills, Education)
- [ ] Keywords from job description included naturally
- [ ] No tables, columns, or text boxes
- [ ] Simple formatting (no complex layouts)
- [ ] Contact information at top
- [ ] Consistent date formats (MMM YYYY - MMM YYYY)

## Testing Your CV

### Manual Testing
1. **Print test**: Print PDF and check readability from 2 feet away
2. **6-second test**: Can someone identify your key value in 6 seconds?
3. **Mobile test**: Check web version on actual mobile device
4. **Link test**: Click every link in PDF and web versions
5. **Copy test**: Copy text from PDF - does it paste cleanly?

### Automated Testing
1. **ATS simulation**: Use Jobscan or similar tools
2. **Accessibility**: Run WAVE or aXe on web version
3. **Performance**: PageSpeed Insights for web version
4. **File size**: PDF should be under 1MB

### Peer Review
1. Have someone unfamiliar read for 10 seconds
2. Ask: "What did I do?" and "What technologies do I know?"
3. If they can't answer clearly, revise for clarity

## Common Mistakes to Avoid

### Content Mistakes
‚ùå Vague achievements: "Improved performance"
‚úÖ Quantified: "Improved page load time by 40%"

‚ùå Job duties: "Responsible for code reviews"
‚úÖ Impact: "Conducted 200+ code reviews, maintaining team coding standards"

‚ùå Technology lists: "Experienced with React, Vue, Angular"
‚úÖ Specific: "React, Vue" (only list what you've actually used in jobs)

### Formatting Mistakes
‚ùå Fancy fonts: Brush Script, Comic Sans
‚úÖ Professional: Helvetica, Arial, Calibri

‚ùå Colored text: Blue or green section headers
‚úÖ Black text: Pure black (#000000) everything

‚ùå Graphics: Icons, charts, profile photos
‚úÖ Text only: Clean, scannable content

‚ùå Small font: 8pt body text
‚úÖ Readable: 10-11pt body text

### Technical Mistakes
‚ùå Emojis in PDF: üì¶ npm package
‚úÖ Text only: npm (or npm package)

‚ùå Complex layouts: Three-column design
‚úÖ Simple: Single column, left-aligned

‚ùå Large file: 5MB PDF with embedded images
‚úÖ Optimized: <500KB PDF, text only

## Version Control

### File Naming
```
Web Version: cv_data.json
PDF Export: FirstName_LastName_CV.pdf
Backup: cv_data_YYYYMMDD.json
```

### Change Log
Document significant changes:
- Date of change
- What was changed (content, format, both)
- Reason for change (job application, feedback, etc.)
- Version number (semantic versioning for major updates)

### Archival
- Keep dated backups of major versions
- Store successful CVs (ones that got interviews)
- Note which version was used for which application

## References

### Inspiration Sources
- Laszlo Horvath CV (hired at Google)
- Microsoft's CV guidelines
- Google's technical resume guide
- Amazon's leadership principles format

### Tools
- **ATS Testing**: Jobscan, Resume Worded
- **PDF Generation**: jsPDF (for code), Adobe Acrobat (for export)
- **Accessibility**: WAVE, aXe DevTools
- **Proofreading**: Grammarly, Hemingway Editor

## Maintenance

### Regular Updates
- **Quarterly**: Review for outdated technologies or achievements
- **Before applications**: Customize for specific job descriptions
- **After projects**: Add new achievements with metrics
- **Annual**: Complete rewrite to reflect career growth

### Continuous Improvement
- Request feedback from hiring managers (if possible)
- A/B test different formats (track which gets more responses)
- Stay updated on ATS algorithm changes
- Monitor CV trends in your industry

---

## Summary

The key to a successful CV is **maximum legibility + quantified impact + ATS compatibility**.

**Remember**:
1. **Black text, white background** - always
2. **Metrics in achievements** - every bullet point
3. **Bold the numbers** - for quick scanning
4. **No emojis or special characters** - text only
5. **2 pages maximum** - be ruthlessly concise
6. **Remote indicator** - show work flexibility
7. **Larger fonts** - 10-11pt body, not 8-9pt
8. **Proper spacing** - line height 1.5-1.6
9. **Simple format** - single column, left-aligned
10. **Test everything** - PDF must render perfectly

If in doubt, **simpler is better**. Your achievements should speak for themselves without fancy formatting.
